title: Provider Backbone Bridging Combined with Ethernet VPN (PBB-EVPN)
abstract:
This document discusses how Ethernet Provider Backbone Bridging (PBB) can be
combined with Ethernet VPN (EVPN) in order to reduce the number of BGP MAC
Advertisement routes by aggregating Customer/Client MAC (C-MAC) addresses via
Provider Backbone MAC (B-MAC) address, provide client MAC address mobility
using C-MAC aggregation, confine the scope of C-MAC learning to only active
flows, offer per-site policies, and avoid C-MAC address flushing on topology
changes.  The combined solution is referred to as PBB-EVPN.
